DOC.brief_summary: The main purpose of this study is to assess the induction of neuroinflammation in brain regions of interest for learning and memory in adult patients undergoing urological surgery under general anesthesia
DOC.brief_title: Postoperative Neuroinflammation and Cognitive Dysfunction After Abdominal Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: The investigators aim to study immune cell activation as a biomarker for neuroinflammation using the cell specific [11C]PBR28 probe as detected by PET imaging techniques.
DOC.criteria: 1. Patients 6075 years of age. American Society for Anesthesiologist' criteria (ASA) physical status IIII 2. Lower abdominal surgery (hysterectomy/prostatectomy) under general anaesthesia 3. Obtained consent within 3 months before execution of the study. 1. Patient's refusal to participate in the trial 2. Ongoing smoking, snuff or other nicotine compound treatment 3. Disabling neuropsychiatrical disorder (a Mini mental State Examination (MMSE) score â‰¤ 24, diagnosis of dementia, Mb Alzheimer, Mb Parkinson, schizophrenia, or mental depression) or other signs of significant cognitive decline. 4. History of stroke with neurological sequelae 5. Surgical procedure scheduled for regional anaesthesia. 6. Severe cardia and/or renal and/or hepatic impairment. 7. Coagulopathy. 8. Terminal phase of a chronic disease. 9. Patient on steroidal or nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs. 10. Admission BGlucose > 15 mmol/litre or poorly controlled diabetes mellitus. 11. Presumed uncooperativeness or legal incapacity. 12. Preoperative or later postoperative Bhemoglobin < 90 g/L.
